content:
• Wednesday, December 7, 2011
  • AFFY

    Affymax (OTC:AFFY +8.9%) wins backing from an FDA advisory panel for its peginesatide anemia...

    Affymax (OTC:AFFY +8.9%) wins backing from an FDA advisory panel for its peginesatide anemia drug, which competes with a rival drug from Amgen (NASDAQ:AMGN). AFFY shares jumped 20%-plus on Monday when briefing documents related to today's meeting were released; trading has been halted since early this afternoon.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:14 PM | 1 Comment
  • ARR

    Armour Residential REIT (NYSE:ARR) announces an 8M share secondary offering, with an option to...

    Armour Residential REIT (NYSE:ARR) announces an 8M share secondary offering, with an option to purchase up to 1.2M additional shares as warranted. Deutsche will act as the sole bookrunning manager of the offering. Shares -3.4% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:12 PM | 2 Comments
  • THQIQ

    THQ (THQI) shares are now down 22.6% AH in the wake of the company's big FQ3 warning, making...

    THQ (THQI) shares are now down 22.6% AH in the wake of the company's big FQ3 warning, making 15-year lows in the process. Given THQ's weak balance sheet and recent cash burn (I, II), and the fact FQ3 accounts for the vast majority of its annual profits, concerns about the company's viability are likely on many investors' minds.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:59 PM
  • GIII

    G-III Apparel (NASDAQ:GIII) soars 14.2% AH trading after reporting FQ3 revenue of $510M (+13%...

    G-III Apparel (NASDAQ:GIII) soars 14.2% AH trading after reporting FQ3 revenue of $510M (+13% Y/Y) and EPS of $2.16, beating consensus by $12.5M and $0.02. G-III's guidance for FY12 (ends Jan. 31) is mixed: revenue of $1.25B is slightly above Street forecasts, but EPS of $2.50-$2.60 falls below a $2.80 consensus.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:52 PM
  • PSUN

    Pacific Sunwear (NASDAQ:PSUN) skies 40% AH after announcing a deal with its landlords to close...

    Pacific Sunwear (NASDAQ:PSUN) skies 40% AH after announcing a deal with its landlords to close 175-200 underperforming stores and new financing from its lenders. For good measure, the company also announced a Q3 loss of ($0.10), beating by $0.04 on revenue of $242M ($233M expected). (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:49 PM | 2 Comments
  • JCP

    One possible reason for the indifferent reaction in J.C. Penney (JCP +0.6%) shares to the...

    One possible reason for the indifferent reaction in J.C. Penney (JCP +0.6%) shares to the retailer's new stake in Martha Stewart (MSO +33.3%): Kmart's (SHLD) similar deal with MSO a while back was a disaster. The spike in MSO is harder to explain, since the deal appears to end the "strategic alternatives" it was considering. Were there no good offers, or does Martha refuse to sell?
     
     
     
     
    | 4:43 PM
  • THQIQ

    Validating yesterday's Cowen downgrade, game developer THQ (THQI -11%) warns it expects its FQ3...

    Validating yesterday's Cowen downgrade, game developer THQ (THQI -11%) warns it expects its FQ3 revenue to be roughly 25% below prior guidance of $510M-$550M, on account of weaker-than-expected sales of its uDraw graphics tablet for the Xbox 360 and PlayStation 3. Today's major decline in THQ shares suggests some knew about the news in advance. Shares are halted until 4:30.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:23 PM
  • RJETQ

    Republic Airways (RJET) finishes the day up 4.2% after it says it generated 1.7B revenue...

    Republic Airways (RJET) finishes the day up 4.2% after it says it generated 1.7B revenue passenger miles, up 2% from a year ago. Capacity decreased 2% however, to 2B available seat miles.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:04 PM
  • LDOS

    SAIC (SAI +6.9%) moves to the top of the S&P leader board after posting better-than-expected...

    SAIC (SAI +6.9%) moves to the top of the S&P leader board after posting better-than-expected Q3 numbers while pointing to challenges ahead. Analysts were impressed with new business bookings, although CityTime litigation that likely won't be finalized until 2013 and the continuing CEO search could slow thinking on capital allocation.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:56 PM
  • ALL

    Allstate (ALL +0.8%) gains after Credit Suisse initiates the shares with an Outperform rating...

    Allstate (ALL +0.8%) gains after Credit Suisse initiates the shares with an Outperform rating earlier today. The firm says margin estimates are too low, and restructuring will result in improved top-line results in the second half of FY12.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:56 PM
  • IBM

    Shares of IBM (IBM +1%) are up on reports that antitrust regulators in the European Union plan...

    Shares of IBM (IBM +1%) are up on reports that antitrust regulators in the European Union plan to accept concessions offered by the technology giant and close an antitrust probe, averting a potential fine for the company.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:46 PM | 1 Comment
  • QIHU

    Citron Research isn't taking a breather in its attack (I, II, III) on Qihoo 360 (QIHU -2.6%)....

    Citron Research isn't taking a breather in its attack (I, II, III) on Qihoo 360 (QIHU -2.6%). Its latest note is titled "Qihoo 360 is Committing Fraud - Plain and Simple," and features a point-by-point refutation of recent comments made by CFO Alex Xu that defend the legitimacy of his company's ad sales figures.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:43 PM
  • ECA

    Encana (ECA +2.5%) shoots higher after announcing an agreement to sell 2 natural gas processing...

    Encana (ECA +2.5%) shoots higher after announcing an agreement to sell 2 natural gas processing plants to Veresen for about $930M. With this deal, Encana has raised about $3.5B in 2011 through asset sales. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 3:41 PM
  • ECHO

    Echo Global Logistics (ECHO -0.5%) bounces back from earlier losses after announcing it was...

    Echo Global Logistics (ECHO -0.5%) bounces back from earlier losses after announcing it was purchasing privately-held Trailer Transport Systems, an intermodal marketing company based in Rochester, New York, for an undisclosed sum.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:30 PM
  • OSGB

    Shares of Overseas Shipholding (OSG -3.3%) sink after Moody's cuts the shipper two notches...

    Shares of Overseas Shipholding (OSG -3.3%) sink after Moody's cuts the shipper two notches deeper into junk and left the door open for additional cuts. The ratings service notes weak fundamentals in the global tanker sector are hurting its liquidity.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:26 PM
  • AMP

    Shares of Ameriprise (AMP +1%) trade higher after the company's board declares a $0.28 per share...

    Shares of Ameriprise (AMP +1%) trade higher after the company's board declares a $0.28 per share dividend, a 22% increase from current levels.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:09 PM
  • UL

    Unilever (UL +1%) is trading higher today, despite reports that workers in the U.K. are...

    Unilever (UL +1%) is trading higher today, despite reports that workers in the U.K. are preparing to strike for the first time on Friday. Over 2,500 employees will be walking off their jobs and manning picket lines at sites across England to protest against the company's plans to eliminate its final salary pension scheme.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:05 PM
  • PFE

    An FDA advisory committee unanimously recommends approval of Pfizer's (PFE +1.3%) drug axitinib...

    An FDA advisory committee unanimously recommends approval of Pfizer's (PFE +1.3%) drug axitinib for use in patients with advanced kidney cancer. Pfizer research showed the new drug was at least as effective as Nexavar, a drug already on the market made by Bayer and Onyx (ONXX -2.7%).

     
     
     
     
    | 3:02 PM
  • MMC

    Marsh & McLennan (MMC +0.8%) gains after Credit Suisse initiates coverage with a Neutral...

    Marsh & McLennan (MMC +0.8%) gains after Credit Suisse initiates coverage with a Neutral rating, saying the company will continue to build on its market share momentum, especially in the reinsurance space, in 2012.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:00 PM
  • AKS

    AK Steel (AKS -1.5%) dips after saying it will increase prices for all carbon flat-rolled steel...

    AK Steel (AKS -1.5%) dips after saying it will increase prices for all carbon flat-rolled steel products, effective immediately. Base prices will be increased by $40 per ton for hot rolled carbon steel products, and by $50 per ton for cold rolled and coated carbon steel products.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:53 PM
  • PHM

    Homebuilders trade lower after a report by Fannie Mae indicates consumers are expecting home...

    Homebuilders trade lower after a report by Fannie Mae indicates consumers are expecting home prices to rise for the first time in six months: PulteGroup (PHM -2.4%), KB Home (KBH -1.5%), Toll Brothers (TOL -2.4%), Standard Pacific (SPF -1.2%).

     
     
     
     
    | 2:48 PM
  • M

    Macy's (NYSE:M) says it will review its sale of Martha Stewart Living (MSO +30.5%) products,...

    Macy's (NYSE:M) says it will review its sale of Martha Stewart Living (MSO +30.5%) products, following the latter's deal with J.C. Penney (NYSE:JCP). The partnership will include the opening of Martha Stewart "store-in-stores" by Feb. 2013, as well as the co-development of an e-commerce site that will launch in 2013. It's estimated the tie-up will generate $200M in revenue for MSO over its 10-year lifetime.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:42 PM
  • QRVO

    HTC's weak November sales are likely adding to the selloff in supplier RF Micro Devices (RFMD),...

    HTC's weak November sales are likely adding to the selloff in supplier RF Micro Devices (RFMD), which is down 7.5% in spite of positive comments from Sterne Agee. While noting recent concerns about pricing, customer weakness, and share losses to SWKS, the firm thinks a RF Micro will get a lift from its partnerships with Samsung and QCOM. Rival TQNT is up 3%, perhaps due to iPhone optimism. (previously)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:29 PM
  • IMAX

    Imax (IMAX -3.1%) is ramping up its presence in Asia with new deals to expand in China and open...

    Imax (IMAX -3.1%) is ramping up its presence in Asia with new deals to expand in China and open its first-ever screens in Indonesia. An agreement with Chinese distributor Orange Sky ensures installation of its digital systems in four additional Chinese theaters between late 2012 and the end of 2014.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:23 PM
  • MNI

    McClatchy (MNI +41.5%) soars after saying it's seeing better advertising trends in the current...

    McClatchy (MNI +41.5%) soars after saying it's seeing better advertising trends in the current quarter, led by strong performance in national and retail advertising. The report mirrors an earlier statement by its peer Gannett (GCI +5.2%) at the same conference.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:22 PM
  • GBG

    Great Basin Gold (GBG +15%) pops after the miner says its executed its previously announced...

    Great Basin Gold (GBG +15%) pops after the miner says its executed its previously announced $150M credit facility agreement with Credit Suisse and Standard Chartered Bank. The facility has a maximum term of 5 years and bears an interest rate margin of 4% over the LIBOR rate.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:14 PM
  • NCS

    Construction supplier NCI Building Systems (NCS +10.6%) gains after its FQ4 revenue results...

    Construction supplier NCI Building Systems (NCS +10.6%) gains after its FQ4 revenue results topped analysts' estimates earlier this morning, despite missing on a per share basis. The company also pointed to " positive momentum" in its guidance for FY12, saying its bookings and backlog are showing significant signs of improvement.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:06 PM
  • STRI

    STR Holdings (STRI +4.1%) says it's appointed Robert Yorgensen, the company's current president...

    STR Holdings (STRI +4.1%) says it's appointed Robert Yorgensen, the company's current president for STR Solar, as its president and CEO effective January 2012. Mr. Yorgensen will succeed retiring CEO Dennis Jilot, who will continue to serve as chairman of the company's board of directors.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:58 PM
  • AAL

    US Airways (LCC +3.8%) gets an added boost from an upgrade to Buy at CRT Capital on valuation,...

    US Airways (LCC +3.8%) gets an added boost from an upgrade to Buy at CRT Capital on valuation, saying the carrier is likely to benefit the most from American Airlines' bankruptcy.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:55 PM
  • TRV

    Travelers (TRV +1.4%) ticks higher after Credit Suisse initiates coverage with an Outperform...

    Travelers (TRV +1.4%) ticks higher after Credit Suisse initiates coverage with an Outperform rating, saying the insurer is levered to gain from higher homeowner and commercial rates.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:46 PM
  • CVE

    Cenovus Energy (CVE +1.2%) says its capital budget will increase 23% next year and oil...

    Cenovus Energy (CVE +1.2%) says its capital budget will increase 23% next year and oil production will increase 21%, to an average of 163K barrels a day, as the Canadian driller continues to expand its oil-sands operations.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:40 PM
  • SODA

    Sodastream (SODA +3.2%) shoots higher after William Blair says it expects further distribution...

    Sodastream (SODA +3.2%) shoots higher after William Blair says it expects further distribution gains in 2012 for the maker of home beverage carbonation systems, due to broader store rollouts at Target and Staples and the likely addition of Wal-Mart (NYSE:WMT). The firm expects SODA's momentum to continue and keeps an Outperform rating on the stock.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:39 PM | 1 Comment
  • CRK

    Comstock Resources (CRK +1.5%) moves higher on an Oppenheimer upgrade to Outperform, citing an...

    Comstock Resources (CRK +1.5%) moves higher on an Oppenheimer upgrade to Outperform, citing an improved 2012 outlook following the company's announced acquisition in the Permian Basin earlier this week. Oppenheimer says the company now has two core oil plays to drive production growth, which should translate into sharply higher earnings and cash flow going forward.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:19 PM
  • VALE

    Brazilian mining company Vale (VALE -2.3%) says there are "a lot of uncertainties" regarding its...

    Brazilian mining company Vale (VALE -2.3%) says there are "a lot of uncertainties" regarding its massive Simandou iron ore project in Guinea due to difficult negotiations with the local government. The project has the potential to ship over 50M tons a year of high-class iron ore, but a complex port and railway system are needed, and the cost of developing this infrastructure could total more than $12B.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:05 PM
  • PGR

    Progessive (PGR -1.9%) dips after Credit Suisse initiates the shares with a Neutral rating,...

    Progessive (PGR -1.9%) dips after Credit Suisse initiates the shares with a Neutral rating, saying increased competition from Esurance and Geico on the direct marketing front are going to put pressure on margins over the near-term.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:48 PM | 1 Comment
  • FSLR

    First Solar's (FSLR +7.1%) agreement to sell its 550-megawatt Topaz Solar Farm power plant...

    First Solar's (FSLR +7.1%) agreement to sell its 550-megawatt Topaz Solar Farm power plant removes an overhang on FSLR shares, but Auriga sees broader implications:The deal is proof that "high quality projects will get financing even in a dislocated macro environment... and will have a positive perception effect" on SPWRA, WFR and others in downstream projects.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:21 PM | 4 Comments
  • CNX

    Shares of CONSOL Energy (CNX -2%) trades lower despite its announcement that it's achieved gas...

    Shares of CONSOL Energy (CNX -2%) trades lower despite its announcement that it's achieved gas production levels in excess of 500 MMcf per day. Additionally, due to the success of its Marcellus Shale program, the company raises its Q4 gas production estimate to 38 - 40 bcf, up from its earlier view of 36 - 38 bcf.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:19 PM
  • YNDX

    Yandex (YNDX +4.4%) shares pop after the Russian internet search provider announces the...

    Yandex (YNDX +4.4%) shares pop after the Russian internet search provider announces the integration of its music service with Facebook. The new system will display the names of tracks to which a Yandex.Muzika user is listening on the Facebook news feed displayed to friends.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:07 PM
  • OMI

    Medical and surgical supply distributor Owens & Minor (OMI -2.8%) guides lower for 2012, now...

    Medical and surgical supply distributor Owens & Minor (OMI -2.8%) guides lower for 2012, now expecting Y/Y revenue growth of just 3% to 5% and net income per share growth of 5% to 10%. Analysts had been forecasting 6% revenue growth and 12% per share earnings growth.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:59 AM
  • GRPN

    Groupon (GRPN +4.9%) is up sharply today; share now back above their $20 IPO price, and up up...

    Groupon (GRPN +4.9%) is up sharply today; share now back above their $20 IPO price, and up up 37% from their Nov. 28 low. Short-covering is likely a factor, given Groupon's heavy short interest, and so might the company's introduction of Groupon Scheduler, a service that allows consumers and merchants to set up and manage appointments stemming from purchased deals.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:52 AM | 1 Comment
  • GCI

    Gannett (GCI +8.2%) is rallying for the second time this week (previously), after the newspaper...

    Gannett (GCI +8.2%) is rallying for the second time this week (previously), after the newspaper owner states at a UBS conference (webcast) it's seeing indications of improved business activity, and is comfortable with Q4 EPS estimates.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:43 AM
  • SMG

    Scotts Miracle-Gro (SMG +2.1%) bounces back after issuing a downbeat FQ1 forecast as Oppenheimer...

    Scotts Miracle-Gro (SMG +2.1%) bounces back after issuing a downbeat FQ1 forecast as Oppenheimer defends the stock, saying the lowered guidance was expected. The company had warned that results would be weak, and, more importantly, it's maintained its FY sales guidance and reduced cost pressures by securing over 60% of its raw materials for 2012.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:42 AM
  • OPEN

    Investors are losing their appetite for restaurant reservation service OpenTable (OPEN -1.6%),...

    Investors are losing their appetite for restaurant reservation service OpenTable (OPEN -1.6%), whose shares have shed 67% since April amid a continued slow economy and competition from newer, cheaper services. Yet shares are still “lofty” considering that OPEN hasn’t yet proved it has a plan to maintain its market leadership, a Morgan Keegan analyst says.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:39 AM
  • JBLU

    The battle for DFW: JetBlue (JBLU +4.1%) says it will add 3 daily flights to the Dallas-Forth...

    The battle for DFW: JetBlue (JBLU +4.1%) says it will add 3 daily flights to the Dallas-Forth Worth airport with service slated to begin May 2012. It's just the latest move in an ongoing chess battle between carriers strategizing to take advantage of an anticipated reduction in AMR's capacity.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:31 AM | 1 Comment
  • CSCO

    Broadsoft (BSFT +1.3%), a provider of software that helps telcos and cable providers deliver...

    Broadsoft (BSFT +1.3%), a provider of software that helps telcos and cable providers deliver VoIP services, outperforms after receiving Buy ratings from Mizuho and Brigantine. While noting shares are expensive, Mizuho expects the growing corporate adoption of unified communications systems bolstering the company, and also thinks its IP and customer base makes it a possible buyout target.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:25 AM
  • CVC

    Cablevision (CVC -1.2%) has filed a lawsuit in Federal Court accusing Verizon (VZ -1%) of...

    Cablevision (CVC -1.2%) has filed a lawsuit in Federal Court accusing Verizon (VZ -1%) of embarking on an advertising campaign which makes intentionally false and misleading claims related to Cablevision's high-speed Internet service. Despite being fully aware of the false claims, Verizon has refused to stop running its ads, and the company says it's been forced to take legal action to halt them.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:16 AM | 1 Comment
  • VEOEY

    Veolia Environnement (VE -1.2%) drifts lower after being downgraded to Hold at Deutsche Bank on...

    Veolia Environnement (VE -1.2%) drifts lower after being downgraded to Hold at Deutsche Bank on valuation, citing a lack of catalysts and high execution risk due to poor visibility.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:06 AM
  • PEG

    Public Service Enterprise (PEG -1.5%) trades lower after Goldman cuts the shares to Neutral,...

    Public Service Enterprise (PEG -1.5%) trades lower after Goldman cuts the shares to Neutral, citing low demand growth and weak pricing for regional power markets, and potential risk from the upcoming New Jersey BGS auction in February.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:57 AM
  • JAGGF

    Jaguar Mining (JAG -9.1%) trades lower after announcing its President and CEO Daniel Titcomb has...

    Jaguar Mining (JAG -9.1%) trades lower after announcing its President and CEO Daniel Titcomb has resigned, naming a committee of directors to run its operations until a replacement is found. The abrupt departure comes just weeks after the miner acknowledged Shangdong Gold had made a $785M bid for the company and was launching a strategic review to explore its options.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:40 AM
  • S

    RBC cuts its rating on Sprint (S -3.1%) to Sector Perform, with a reduced price target to $3...

    RBC cuts its rating on Sprint (S -3.1%) to Sector Perform, with a reduced price target to $3 from $4, writing that the company is entering its “peak cash burn” phase for several quarters with no likely “positive catalyst” during that time. RBC sees "significant uncertainty" around the pace of Network Vision 4G implementation and other planned technologies.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:36 AM
  • POWL

    Shares of Powell Industries (POWL +10%) gain after the firm steers FY12 guidance in-line with...

    Shares of Powell Industries (POWL +10%) gain after the firm steers FY12 guidance in-line with the estimates of analysts on top of its $0.05 FQ4 earnings miss. Investors may be warming up to the firm's healthy backlog of $443M (+57% Y/Y) in orders.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:33 AM
  • BTU

    Peabody Energy (BTU -3.2%) takes a hit after being downgraded to Neutral at Goldman on relative...

    Peabody Energy (BTU -3.2%) takes a hit after being downgraded to Neutral at Goldman on relative valuation, citing lower U.S. thermal volumes and cost pressures at its Illinois Basin/Western Bit thermal business.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:27 AM | 1 Comment
  • WMT

    Surprisingly up in a down tape (and nearing a 52-week high) this morning is Wal-Mart (WMT...

    Surprisingly up in a down tape (and nearing a 52-week high) this morning is Wal-Mart (WMT +1.2%). Overnight, India reversed a decision which would have allowed the company greater access into the country, seemingly one of the last great growth opportunities left.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:17 AM | 3 Comments
  • AMRC

    Ameresco (NYSE:AMRC), a provider of energy-efficiency upgrade services, is up 2.3% following...

    Ameresco (NYSE:AMRC), a provider of energy-efficiency upgrade services, is up 2.3% following positive comments from Oppenheimer. The firm says it returned from a meeting with management "highly encouraged" about Ameresco's growth prospects, and thinks a recent Presidential Memorandum instructing federal agencies to spend a minimum of $2B on energy-efficiency upgrades will give the company a lift.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:16 AM
  • MRVL

    Marvell (MRVL +1.6%) is upped to Buy from Hold with a raised $22 price target at Craig Hallum,...

    Marvell (MRVL +1.6%) is upped to Buy from Hold with a raised $22 price target at Craig Hallum, which believes the troubles in the hard-drive industry caused by Thailand flooding will cause a smaller impact than the Street has expected. Also, MRVL “is gaining traction in WCMDA smartphones, which lessens the impact of potential continued headwinds from RIMM."

     
     
     
     
    | 10:04 AM | 1 Comment
  • FRAN

    Shares of Francesca's Holdings (NASDAQ:FRAN) jump 7.5% higher after the firm knocks out a Q3...

    Shares of Francesca's Holdings (NASDAQ:FRAN) jump 7.5% higher after the firm knocks out a Q3 earnings beat of a penny on in-line revenue of $50M. The firm lowered its FY11 projection for capital expenditures to $16M-$17M, from prior guidance of $18M-$20M.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:56 AM
  • TLB

    Talbots (TLB +61.5%) shares are soaring but not above the $3/share price of the Sycamore...

    Talbots (TLB +61.5%) shares are soaring but not above the $3/share price of the Sycamore takeover offer, as investors may lack faith in Talbots - which put in place measures to prevent unwanted takeovers - to negotiate a sale. Talbots shares have lost more 80% YTD as the retailer consistently raises alarms about lagging sales or profit margins (Q3).

     
     
     
     
    | 9:53 AM
  • LNT

    Alliant Energy's (LNT +1.4%) recent moves to revise provisions for executive pay and employee...

    Alliant Energy's (LNT +1.4%) recent moves to revise provisions for executive pay and employee retirement plans in case of a takeover sparks speculation that the operator of power plants in Wisconsin and Iowa could sell itself to Berkshire Hathaway (NYSE:BRK.A) or Wisconsin Energy (NYSE:WEC).

     
     
     
     
    | 9:41 AM

  • Market preview: EU stocks and S&P futures (-0.2%) turn from green to red following reports...

    Market preview: EU stocks and S&P futures (-0.2%) turn from green to red following reports that Germany is giving up hope of achieving an all-encompassing deal to save the universe this week. Why the markets might have enjoyed such high hopes in the first place is the question. ING -6.7% after saying it will take a charge of up to €1.1B; C -2.1% after announcing more job cuts. Later: consumer credit.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM
  • VRA

    More on Vera Bradley (NASDAQ:VRA) (previous): Jefferies analyst Randal Konik keeps the faith on...

    More on Vera Bradley (NASDAQ:VRA) (previous): Jefferies analyst Randal Konik keeps the faith on shares of VRA, saying in a note to clients that he's upbeat for Q4 because shoppers are reacting favorably to the firm's winter and holiday line of products. Konik keeps a Buy rating and $50 price target firmly in place for the stock he views as a long-term growth story. Shares -7.1% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:08 AM
  • VRA

    Shares of Vera Bradley (NASDAQ:VRA) take it on the chin in premarket trading, down 7.5%, after...

    Shares of Vera Bradley (NASDAQ:VRA) take it on the chin in premarket trading, down 7.5%, after the firm's FQ3 results and FQ4 outlook fail to impress. The retailer expects EPS to fall in a $0.44-$0.47 range, lower than the standing estimate of analysts for FQ4.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:01 AM
  • TLB

    Premarket gainers: TLB +72%. MSO +33%. AMR +14%. FSLR +4%. CLWR +3%.Losers: ING -8%. VRA -7%....

    Premarket gainers: TLB +72%. MSO +33%. AMR +14%. FSLR +4%. CLWR +3%.
    Losers: ING -8%. VRA -7%. FRO -5%. CTIC -5%. NOK -3%. BBVA -3%. DB -3%. STD -3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:00 AM
  • MIND

    Shares of Mitcham Industries (NASDAQ:MIND) trade 17% higher premarket following the firm's...

    Shares of Mitcham Industries (NASDAQ:MIND) trade 17% higher premarket following the firm's massive Q3 earnings beat. The firm saw strong demand for equipment leasing in Latin America and from areas with shale resources in the U.S.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:55 AM
  • SMG

    Scott's Miracle-Gro (NYSE:SMG) issues downward guidance for FQ1, citing expected lower sales...

    Scott's Miracle-Gro (NYSE:SMG) issues downward guidance for FQ1, citing expected lower sales volume and continued pressure from high commodity costs. The lawn-and-garden products company sees a loss of $1.20-$1.25/share vs. -$1.13 consensus and -$0.99 a year ago; sales are seen at ~$200M vs. $234.9M consensus and $230.2M a year ago. SMG -3.7% premarket.

  • DG
